summary: The overview primarily revolves around the concept of 'ecosystem architecture' applied to modern human organizations, highlighting a shift from traditional hierarchical structures to more decentralized forms. It draws on themes of space and time to illustrate these changes in social and business networks, emphasizing the broader application of biological terminology to organizational design.
excerpt: The term ecosystem has transcended its biological roots to describe new forms of human organization that are less hierarchical and more dispersed, necessitating a new practice called ecosystem architecture.
